archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files
1930-1934

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access restrictions may apply to specific student records under the terms of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (F.E.R.P.A.).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files, Accession #RG-2/1/2.491 I, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was transferred by the Office of the President, Pavilion VIII-East Lawn, University of Virginia on 1979 November 15.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These files constitute the major record series generated by the president of the University of Virginia. The records consist chiefly of correspondence, but also include reports, minutes, clippings, memoranda, and related papers concerning all areas of business of the president's office.

did.unittitle: "A" Miscellaneous (2 folders) (American Association for the Advancement of Science; American Council on Education, minutes; American Field Service Fellowships; American Foundation [American Peace award]; America Philosophical Society; American Shakespeare Foundation; 2 ALS, Sherwood Anderson to Newcomb, author's meeting at U.Va., speaks of possible debate w/ Bertrand Russell) 1930-1934
Administrative Council (Disciplinary measures including false fire alarms, suppression of 'Cavalier', etc.) 1930-1934
Alderman, E. A. (clippings and lists of pallbearers for his funeral) 1930-1934
Alderman, E. A. (4 folders) (correspondence re: death of) 1930-1934
Alderman, E. A. (2 folders) (replies to invitations to memorial services in honor of) 1930-1934

Art, Architecture, and Music (Investigation of Architectural School; Changes in Fayerweather; Virginia Players--Luther Greene; loss of etchings; Payne Collection to be kept up; James Minor's Spanish Paintings; Allyn Cox--Cartoons of Greek Subjects; Hammarstrand affair; Musical Study Equipment, Carnegie Corporation; Music needs--Fickensher and Pratt) 1930-1934
Art, Architecture, and Music--Bayly Museum (correspondence, drawings, and construction) 1930-1934

Articles on U.VA. (History of Political Science Department; Science Service, Budgets, Research and Personnel in Universities; "The Univ. of Va. in the Life of the Changing South"; "The McIntire School of Commerce"; "Notes on the Development and Work of the School of Sociology since Sept. 1927." "A Survey of the Manuscripts in Va."; "Training of Teachers for Secondary Schools"; "The last 10 years in Biology at the U.Va."; "Dr. Benton to Zehmer--Chemistry";"Institute for Research in Soc. Sci."; "Va. Quarterly Review"; "School of History"; "School of Psych."; "School of Medicine";"Library") 1930-1934
Astronomy, Department of (S. A. Mitchell's election as Associate of the Royal Astronomical Society; National Academy of Sciences; Accomplishments at the Observatory; Eclipse Expedition) 1930-1934
Author's Convention (TLS; DuBose Heyward to Newcomb) 1930-1934
"B" Miscellaneous (3 folders) (Tree planting in memory of G. Washington; Byrd, Harry; Byrd, Richard) 1930-1934
Biology--Mountain Lake (dedication exercises; historical sketch; annual reports; swimming curriculum) 1930-1934
Bursar--(1, 2) Furniture owned by University in President's House; Scholarship to American Academy in Rome) 1930-1934

"C" Miscellaneous (1-2 of 4) (Catlett, George--Woodrow Wilson Birthplace; Chamberlain, Bernard--Wertenbaker and McIntire funerals; Chamber of Commerce, proposed use of Pantops; Unemployment in Charlottesville; markers showing U.Va.; Memoranda re: new residents; Society of Cincinnati medals, awards; Citizens Committee of 1000; Clemmons, Mrs. Harry--Rivanna Garden Club to plant Jefferson Garden) 1930-1934
Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching 1930-1934
Chaloner, John Armstrong to Alderman--Opinions on Modern Youth 1930-1934
Clemmons, Harry to Newcomb (transcript of hearings of National Industrial Recovery Administration) 1930-1934
Commons (audit; need of boiler; sale of tickets) 1930-1934
"D" Miscellaneous (Dabney, Virginius--articles in Richmond Times Dispatch; Delta Tau Delta) 1930-1934
"E" Miscellaneous (Mrs. Edmunds 3 bronzes sent to U.Va.) 1930-1934
Extension Division (Stone Collection; The Mind in Motion, News Feature) 1930-1934

Fellowships and Scholarships (2 folders) (Joanna Davidge--Randall MacIver Scholarship, Life and Purpose; Robert Burns Waddy Scholarship Requirements; Ms. Janie Slaughter Consular Scholarship; Phelps-Stokes Fellowship, Paper based on house-to-house canvass of all Negro houses in ten square miles; Medical Scholarships Awards) 1930-1934
Forestry (Seward Forest;- description of estate; trees on the grounds) 1930-1934
Founder's Day (Gifts, Speakers; John C. Merriam, Edgar Odell Lovett, Hon. Michael MacWhite: portrait of John Taylor Lomax) 1930-1934
"G" Miscellaneous (Armistead Churchill Gordon; Frank Graham; Gold Goblet belonging to J. L. Cabell) 1930-1934
German Scholars--Emergency Committee on Aid of 1930-1934
Governor's Office (10% cut; Dock Anderson case) 1930-1934

"H" Miscellaneous (2 folders) (Haden, W. D.--Chamber of Commerce Beautification; Hamilton, J. G. deRoulhac--re: Curry papers; Hampton Institute Summer School for coaches; Harrison, Robert L., Copy of Will; Harris Hart, State Committee on Illiteracy; Hubert, Conrad Estate; ALS, Henderson, Archibald; Henderson, Louise re: 1st Professor of National Philosophy; Hibbard, Mrs. Ford--Kearney House for sale; Hind, A. M.; Hitchcock, John; Hollins Endowment--Improvement Fund Campaign; Human Welfare Group) 1930-1934
Honor System (Speech by George Eager, Jr.) 1930-1934
Institute for Research in the Social Sciences see Social Sciences, Institute 1930-1934

Institute of Public Affairs (2 folders) (Lady Astor; Nicholas Murray Butler; Topics of Round Table Discussions; Henry L. Stinson, Refusal; newton D. Baker, Refusal; Report of Committee on Education for Citizenship; Meeting of Monroe Centennial memorial Connection; Loan of Peale Portrait of Jefferson; F. D. Roosevelt accepts and then declines; Norman Thomas, Address; Oswald Villard, Address; Will Durant, Address; Frank Londen, address; Josephus Daniels; F. D. Roosevelt) 1930-1934

"K" Miscellaneous (Kappa Delta Pi; Kappa Sigma; Kearny, Thomas, Lewis Mountain property for sale conditions; Kentucky Students, plan to visit Harlan and Bell Co. Tour; Kentucky, University of, 8th Annual Educational Conference; Kahn Foundation, Nominations needed) 1930-1934

"L" Miscellaneous (Lancaster, Dabney, McKnight Case; Lane, Ernest--re: full Professor in Math Department; Lamer, Mary--Stratford on the Potomac; Leguia President -re: Peruvian room; Library, Addresses of Booker T. Washington with introduction by Dillard) 1930-1934
Law (Requirements for entrance [age]; survey of Criminal Justice in Virginia; List of Books added to Law Library; John Taylor Lomax portrait) 1930-1934
Lectures--(Richard: James Moffatt; W. F. Albright) 1930-1934
Legislative Program (2 folders) (Statement of urgent needs of U.Va.; Reduction by 10 percent of salaries; Gary-Moffett bill) 1930-1934

Library (2 folders) (Gifts of silver pitcher, tray and goblets; Manuscripts, proposed specifications for a new library building; Jefferson and Washington letters; Coolidge gift of 42 original letters by Martha Jefferson and her descendants; Summer School--Library Science) 1930-1934

"M" Miscellaneous (3 folders) (Macedonian Political Organization; McLaughlin, Henry--re: Country Church; Malone, Dumas; Mariner's Museum; Marsh, E. H. -letter enclosing copy of letter from W. Wilson to Solomon B. Griffin; Miller, Hugh Gordon, "Remarks on Radio on Woodrow Wilson") 1930-1934
McCormick-Goodhart, L. M. (models of McCormick Reapers and Jefferson letters for sale) 1930-1934
Medical Department (2 folders)--Monthly Report of Income and Expenses 1930-1934
Medical Department--Public Health; Use of Laboratories 1930-1934

"N" Miscellaneous (2 folders) ( National Association of Publishers Copyrights; National Conference on Mental Hygiene; National Council for Prevention of War--Petition on World Court; National Education Association--Drinking of Youth, Organized Association for Unemployed Teachers, Chicago situation; National Re-creation Association; National World Court; Near-East Relief; Noel Peace Prize; Noell Act) 1930-1934
Newcomb, J. L. (2 folders)--letters and telegrams of congratulation 1930-1934
Norfolk Colleges--Location of Liberal Arts College for Women 1930-1934
"O" Miscellaneous (Oberlin College Commission on Coordination of Efforts for Peace) 1930-1934

"P" Miscellaneous (2 folders) (Page , Kirby Lecture on Disarmament Conference; Pan American Union, Pan American Day, Bolivar room; Pardee, Alfred, Gifts of Charles IV to Indians; Paris, W. F., Gift of a flag to Library of Louvain; Parmelee, A. M., Gift of books; Parrish, H., Narcotic research work; Peace Meetings; Powell, Noble, alderman's Woodrow Wilson; "Progress and Poverty;" Pratt, John L. Public Speaking, engineering Department new building; Prohibition--Officers sent to game; Publications; Public Works) 1930-1934
Physics (Carter's theory of heating engines; appointments) 1930-1934

"R" Miscellaneous (2 folders) (Rabun Gap, Nacoochie School; Randolph, Agnes' death; Randolph, Bessie; Raskob, John, Democratic Party on Prohibition; Raven Society, Sculptures of Harold Cash; Red Cross, annual meetings, John Barton Payne; Registrar, late grades; Allen students; Reynolds, L. R., Virginia Committee on Interracial Cooperation, Summer School Plans; Robertson, A. Willis; Roosevelt, F. D.; Roosevelt, Sara D.) 1930-1934
Radio, Education by (2 folders)--Plans for Programs 1930-1934

"S" Miscellaneous (3 folders) (Sachs, Samuel--re: Ella Sachs Plotz Foundation; Carl Schurz Memorial Foundation; Sigma Phi Epsilon, Scholastic standing of fraternities; re: Harold Cooke; State Conservation and Development Commission, Removal order of State Forester, Chapin Jones; Stonde, Edward L.; Stram Pollution Bill; Stuart, William T., portrait of Philip F. DuPont) 1930-1934
Social Sciences (3 folders) (Institute for Research in) 1930-1934
"T" Miscellaneous (Tayloe, Bladen T., gift of books; Taylor, E. D., Edgehill Jefferson portrait; Troubetzkoy, Pierre re: loan of paintings for exhibition at Duke; Tunstall, Robert) 1930-1934
"U" Miscellaneous (Photography [Underhill]; University of Va. Magazine; short History of U.Va.) 1930-1934

"V" Miscellaneous (Virginia Agriculture Exposition Station; Virginia Association of prep Schools; Virginia Antiquities; Virginia education Association; V.M.I.; Virginia Players; V.P.I.; Virginia Union University;' Visitors, listed geographically) 1930-1934
Visitors--General (2 folders) (Presidency; Resolutions pro Newcomb; Faculty vote; Bayly Art Museum; Hospital to be Built; Gifts, Jefferson letters; Appointments; Committees) 1930-1934

"W" Miscellaneous (4 folders) (Washington and Lee Student Faculty Conference; Washington and Lee Conference on Business Affairs; White, William H., Honorary Degrees; White House Conference on Child health; Women's Temperance Union) 1930-1934
Women's Liberal Arts College, Fredericksburg, Virginia (3 folders) 1930-1934
Women's Liberal Arts College, Hollins (2 folders) 1930-1934
"X-Y-Z" Miscellaneous (Yorktown Sesquicentennial; Young, Howard--Portrait of Virginia Clemm Poe by Sully) 1930-1934
